One of the two teams is very well-rounded and each of their members will run their 400 meter leg in precisely 55 seconds.  The other team is less well-rounded; their first runner will run their 400 meter leg in 60 seconds then each subsequent runner will be 3 seconds faster than the previous runner.  Using this information, how many seconds will the faster team win by?

- Second member runs in (60 - 3) seconds = 57 seconds
- Third member runs in (57 - 3) seconds = 54 seconds
- Fourth member runs in (54 - 3) seconds = 51 seconds

- First member runs in 60 seconds
- Second member runs in 57 seconds
- Third member runs in 54 seconds
- Fourth member runs in 51 seconds

- Third member runs in 55 seconds
- Fourth member runs in 55 seconds

So the sum of their times would be: 55 + 55 + 55 + 55 = 220 seconds. As you can see the better team finishes quicker which means they win the relay by:

- 222 seconds (the slower team) - 220 seconds (the faster team)

The answer is: 2. The difference in seconds is only 2 because relays are decided by hundredths of a second so fractions of a second might play a crucial role here as well.
